Data Appendix The elections data come from a variety of sources: (1) Ferreira and GyourkoÃ¢â¬â¢s (2009) survey of cities; (2) newspapers, official election returns, and other primary sources; and (3) the website OurCampaigns.com, which itself cites primary sources. To be included in the dataset, the election results from OurCampaigns.com had to be properly cited. I verified a random subset of the citations and found no misreporting. The lists below first report the primary sources for the elections dataset and then report any additional sources referenced on OurCampaigns.com.
